what-it-does: Checks if one space is used after inline comments.
why-is-this-bad:
An inline comment is a comment on the same line as a statement.


Per PEP 8, inline comments should start with a # and a single space.
example:
x = x + 1  #Increment x
x = x + 1  #  Increment x
x = x + 1  # \xa0Increment x



Use instead:


x = x + 1  # Increment x
x = x + 1    # Increment x

example-split.example-before:
x = x + 1  #Increment x
x = x + 1  #  Increment x
x = x + 1  # \xa0Increment x
example-split.example-after:
x = x + 1  # Increment x
x = x + 1    # Increment x
